## üìù How to Take a Screenshot

üì• Open the quick capture bar. Make your cursor to the end of the page anytime to capture.  

üì∏ You can also create a Dot by taking a quick screenshot directly from your workspace.

‚å®Ô∏è You can use ALT + S for a quicker way to do it.

<div class="relative box-content w-full max-h-[80vh] aspect-[1.90476] py-10">
  <iframe
    src="https://app.supademo.com/embed/cmj8yvpb608d8f6zpy2jtynnb?embed_v=2&utm_source=embed"

    class="absolute top-0 left-0 w-full h-full"
  ></iframe>
</div>


### üí° Tips

* Each capture automatically becomes a Dot, ready to annotate, organize, and share with your team.

* Use keyboard shortcuts, Pressing ALT + S for a fast and seamless way to create a new Dot without interrupting your workflow.

* Before taking a screenshot, hover over the exact area you want to highlight so your Dot stays clean and focused.
